To check a written text for errors in spelling and grammar.

definitions.definition: Discrediting or disbelieving.

definitions.definition: A degree of dishonour or disesteem; ill repute; reproach.

definitions.definition: To call out; to draw out or bring forth.
To cause the manifestation of something (emotion, picture, etc.) in someone's mind or imagination.

definitions.definition: To elicit a response.
A style of ornamentation characterized by fanciful combinations of intertwined forms.

Distorted and unnatural in shape or size; abnormal and hideous.

From which the water has been removed.
Suffering from dehydration.

A structure which guides waves, such as electromagnetic waves, light, or sound waves.
To act as a waveguide for
Any system of sustainable agriculture that renews natural resources and enriches local ecosystems.

To strip (someone who has been killed or defeated) of their arms or armour.
To strip or deprive (someone) of their possessions; to rob, despoil.
To plunder, pillage (a city, country etc.).
To carry off (goods) by force; to steal.

That which is taken from another by violence; especially, the plunder taken from an enemy; pillage; booty.

In an optimal manner.
Building for housing monks or others who have taken religious vows
A cup-shaped piece of laboratory equipment used to contain chemical compounds when heating them to very high temperatures.
A heat-resistant container in which metals are melted, usually at temperatures above 500°C, commonly made of graphite with clay as a binder.
The bottom and hottest part of a blast furnace; the hearth.
A very difficult and trying experience, that acts as a refining or hardening process.
To speak in generalities, or in vague terms.
To infer or induce from specific cases to more general cases or principles.
To derive or deduce (a general concept or principle) from particular facts.
The ability to assume different forms or shapes.
The coexistence, in the same locality, of two or more distinct forms independent of sex, not connected by intermediate gradations, but produced from common parents.
The feature pertaining to the dynamic treatment of data elements based on their type, allowing for an instance of a method to have several definitions.

(type theory) The property of certain typed formal systems of allowing for the use of type variables and binders/quantifiers over those type variables; likewise, the property of certain expressions (within such typed formal systems) of making use of at least one such typed variable.
The ability of a solid material to exist in more than one form or crystal structure; pleomorphism.
The regular existence of two or more different genotypes within a given species or population; also, variability of amino acid sequences within a gene's protein.
A person who discriminates on grounds of sex; someone who practises sexism.
Unfairly discriminatory against one sex in favour of the other.
The scientific study of embryos.
An aromatic hydrocarbon; a colourless, oily liquid, used in the manufacture of polymers such as polystyrene.

(grammar) A type of noun that refers anaphorically to another noun or noun phrase, but which cannot ordinarily be preceded by a determiner and rarely takes an attributive adjective. English examples include I, you, him, who, me, my, each other.
A female pupil or student (especially of a university or college).
A female graduate.
Able to be induced or caused.
Obtainable by induction; derivable; inferable.
A mistaken belief, a wrong idea

definitions.definition: (usually in the plural) One of the rudimentary mammae of boars.
Of or relating to one or more rudiments.

definitions.definition: Basic; minimal; with less than, or only the minimum, necessary.

A white wine made from this grape (often slightly sweet).
Assessment or sorting according to quality.

That which is picked out, especially broken coffee beans.
To assess or sort according to quality or some other aspect.

definitions.definition: To spread abroad; to propagate.

To shut up or out; to prevent from doing something.

definitions.definition: A believer in a political doctrine that emphasizes individual liberty and a lack of governmental regulation, intervention, and oversight both in matters of the economy (‘free market’) and in personal behavior where no one’s rights are being violated or threatened; also, a ‘classical liberal’, akin to an ‘anarcho-capitalist’.
A left-libertarian, an antiauthoritarian believer in both individual freedom and social justice (social equality and mutual aid), such as a social anarchist.

To smash, or break into tiny pieces.
To dispirit or emotionally defeat
definitions.example: to be shattered in intellect; to have shattered hopes, or a shattered constitution

definitions.definition: To scatter about.
The act of something that shatters; the shattered material
One who inhales.
A device with a canister holding medicine (either in powder or gas form) which is sprayed and inhaled by the patient, often for treating asthma and other respiratory diseases.
To prove (something) to be false or incorrect.
To deny the truth or correctness of (something).
The condition of being granular
The extent to which something is granular
Any of various large seabirds of the family Diomedeidae ranging widely in the Southern Ocean and the North Pacific and having a hooked beak and long narrow wings.
Any of various African and Asian pierid butterflies of the genus Appias. Some species of this genus are also known as puffins.
A double eagle, or three under par on any one hole, except a par 3 hole.
A long-term impediment, burden, or curse.
To give something a definite form; to shape.
To give something a formal or official standing.
To act with formality.
To train again; especially, to train or study in a new subject or job
New or different training, or training in a new field
To compile (program code for a virtual machine) immediately when needed, as part of the execution process.
(originally prison slang slang) An inexperienced, foolhardy young man.
A nickel.
A style of Zimbabwean dance music played with drums and guitar.
To supply with a certificate, especially following certification
That has been subject to certification
Capable of functioning on land or in water.
Occurring on both land and water.
definitions.example: an amphibious attack

definitions.definition: A somewhat liquid mess, often of food; a soft or semisolid substance.
A mixture of noise produced by the harmonics of continuous-wave stations.
The foam of a breaker.
A magmatic body containing a significant proportion of crystals suspended in the liquid phase or melt.
A food comprising cracked or rolled grains cooked in water or milk; porridge.
Cornmeal cooked in water and served as a porridge or as a thick sidedish like grits or mashed potatoes.
A walk, especially across the snow with dogs.
A magic mushroom.
(chiefly Southern England) A form of address to a man.
The face.
To squish so as to break into smaller pieces or to combine with something else.
definitions.example: He mushed the ingredients together.

definitions.definition: To walk, especially across the snow with dogs.
To drive dogs, usually pulling a sled, across the snow.
To notch, cut, or indent (cloth, etc.) with a stamp.
A directive given (usually to dogs or a horse) to start moving, or to move faster.
A shivering tremor, often from fear or horror.
A moment of almost pleasurable fear; a frisson.
To shake nervously, often from fear or horror.
To vibrate jerkily.
A shaped waterproof plank, usually made of wood or foam and reinforced plastic, used to surf on waves.
definitions.example: Two sharks attacked the surfboard.

definitions.definition: To use a surfboard; to surf.
Vision or the faculty of sight.
View or the range of vision.
An Anglican cleric having full legal control of a parish under ecclesiastical law; a rector.
A Protestant minister.
Unfaithfulness in a marriage or an intimate relationship: practice or instance of having a sexual or romantic affair with someone other than one's spouse, without the consent of the spouse.
Unfaithfulness in some other moral obligation.
Lack of religious belief.
Someone (especially one who is male) who is skilled in the work of fighting fire.
A person (originally a man) who keeps the fire going underneath a steam boiler (originally, shoveling coal by hand), particularly on a railroad locomotive or steamship.
By extension of the above, an assistant on any locomotive, whether steam-powered or not.
A relief pitcher.
A safety inspector in coal mines.
A small gun with a relatively short barrel, designed to be held and operated with a single hand.
An ideogram.
To invent by an exercise of ingenuity; to devise
To invent, to make devices; to form designs especially by improvisation.
To project, cast, or set forth, as in a projection of light.
To spend (time, or a period).
Created in a deliberate, rather than natural or spontaneous, way.
Unnatural, forced; artificial, or unrealistic.
A breed of small dog with large ears; a dog of that breed.
A system consisting of the parts of an engine through which burned gases or steam are discharged; see also exhaust system.
The steam let out of a cylinder after it has done its work there.
The dirty air let out of a room through a register or pipe provided for the purpose.
An exhaust pipe, especially on a motor vehicle.
Exhaust gas.
To draw or let out wholly; to drain off completely
definitions.example: Moisture of the earth is exhausted by evaporation.

definitions.definition: To empty by drawing or letting out the contents
definitions.example: to exhaust a treasury

definitions.definition: To drain; to use up or expend wholly, or until the supply comes to an end
definitions.example: I exhausted my strength walking up the hill.

definitions.definition: To tire out; to wear out; to cause to be without any energy
definitions.example: The marathon exhausted me.

definitions.definition: To bring out or develop completely
To discuss thoroughly or completely
definitions.example: That subject has already been fully exhausted.

definitions.definition: To subject to the action of various solvents in order to remove all soluble substances or extractives
definitions.example: to exhaust a drug successively with water, alcohol, and ether

definitions.definition: Something opposite or contrary to something else.
An opponent.
An antonym.
definitions.example: "Up" is the opposite of "down".

definitions.definition: An additive inverse.
One who dreams.
Someone whose beliefs are far from realistic.
Any anglerfish of the family Oneirodidae.
Swallow-wing puffbird (Chelidoptera tenebrosa)
Throughout a city.
Throughout a city.
(chiefly Philadelphia) A combined order of a shot of distilled spirit (especially bourbon) and an order of beer
Any of various large, venomous rays, of the orders Rajiformes and Myliobatiformes, having a barbed, whiplike tail.
A device that simulates a cell tower, used to intercept cell phone communications.
A holder of a franchise; a person who is granted a franchise.
